fields.description:
Being in a story, the field "Estimate:" is not available.

One must get to the board of the projects to see the "Estimate".  Opening the story page, the field disappears (the only field that goes away). 

Also, it is not available in any menu.

(Jira version:  7.9.2)
fields.summary: The field "Estimate" appears only in one way, one view.

fields.description:
h3. Environment
 * Only affects JIRA Administration -> Projects (Admin mode)
 * It's not known why {{issuetype=null}} in database

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a project with any number of issues
 # In database set issue type of any issue to {{null}} value
{code}
update jiraissue set issuetype = null where id = <issue_id>
{code}
 # Reindex Jira
 # Go to <Jira URL>/secure/project/BrowseProjects.jspa

h3. Expected result
Page loads correctly

h3. Actual result
Page responds with 500 showing following stacktrace:
{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.browser.ProjectDataForArchivingCollector.lambda$getMapToUpdatedDate$1236(ProjectDataForArchivingCollector.java:50) [classes/:?]
	at java.util.stream.Collectors.lambda$toMap$173(Collectors.java:1321) [?:1.8.0_65]
	at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$3ReducingSink.accept(ReduceOps.java:169) [?:1.8.0_65]
	at java.util.HashMap$EntrySpliterator.forEachRemaining(HashMap.java:1683) [?:1.8.0_65]
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:481) [?:1.8.0_65]
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471) [?:1.8.0_65]
	at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:708) [?:1.8.0_65]
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234) [?:1.8.0_65]
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.collect(ReferencePipeline.java:499) [?:1.8.0_65]
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.browser.ProjectDataForArchivingCollector.getMapToUpdatedDate(ProjectDataForArchivingCollector.java:50) [classes/:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.browser.BrowseProjects$2.get(BrowseProjects.java:169) [classes/:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.browser.BrowseProjects$2.get(BrowseProjects.java:153) [classes/:?]
	at com.google.common.base.Suppliers$MemoizingSupplier.get(Suppliers.java:125) [guava-18.0.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.browser.BrowseProjects.doExecute(BrowseProjects.java:287) [classes/:?]
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:165) [webwork-1.4-atlassian-30.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:63) [jira-api-7.11.3-SNAPSHOT.jar:?]
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:39) [webwork-1.4-atlassian-30.jar:?]
	at webwork.interceptor.NestedInterceptorChain.proceed(NestedInterceptorChain.java:31) [webwork-1.4-atlassian-30.jar:?]
	at webwork.interceptor.ChainedInterceptor.intercept(ChainedInterceptor.java:16) [webwork-1.4-atlassian-30.jar:?]
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:35) [webwork-1.4-atlassian-30.jar:?]
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:225) [webwork-1.4-atlassian-30.jar:?]
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:154) [webwork-1.4-atlassian-30.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.service(JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.java:138) [classes/:?]
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:742) [servlet-api.jar:?]
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:231) [catalina.jar:8.5.29]
        ...
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
(!) Before executing this operation please [back up your system|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/backing-up-data-938847673.html]

To ensure data integrity, the following steps should be followed:
# Identify the offending issue and its important field values with this SQL query:
{code}
select j.id, j.project, p.pkey, j.issuenum, j.issuetype, j.summary, j.description, j.issuestatus, j.workflow_id
from jiraissue j inner join project p on j.project = p.id
where j.issuetype is null order by p.pkey, j.issuenum;
{code}
Sample output:
{noformat}
id	project	pkey	issuenum	issuetype	summary	description	issuestatus	workflow_id
11300	10200	PUB	3	NULL	test	NULL	10001	11002
{noformat}
(+) Take note of issue ID 11300 for the last step
# From GUI, create a new issue in project PUB (found above) of any issue type
# View the new issue -> Mouse over Edit button -> Get issue ID from browser status bar e.g. 11400
# Run this query to get the same data of the new issue:
{code}
select j.id, j.project, p.pkey, j.issuenum, j.issuetype, j.summary, j.description, j.issuestatus, j.workflow_id
from jiraissue j inner join project p on j.project = p.id
where j.id = 11400
{code}
Sample output:
{noformat}
id	project	pkey	issuenum	issuetype	summary	description	issuestatus	workflow_id
11400	10200	PUB	14	10002	test	NULL	10000	11500
{noformat}
# Update the offending issue (use ID from step 1) with the same issuetype, issuestatus, and workflow_id returned above (if necessary update its summary and description as well):
{code}
update jiraissue set issuetype = 10002, issuestatus = 10000, workflow_id = 11500 where id = 11300;
{code}
(+) This will place the issue in the right type, workflow, and status
# Restart and re-index JIRA
(i) If only 1 project is affected, re-index only that project
fields.summary: Browse projects responds with 500 when any issue has issuetype=null in database

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When setting the 'Browse Project' project permission to 'Reporter', 'Current Assignee' or 'Group Custom Field'  it is expected for users does not meet any of the mentioned criteria in the project, they are not able to see the project or the issues in it at all. However, it seems that users are still able to see the project despite not meeting the any of the criteria. Though, they are not able to see the issues.

h3. Expected Results
Users that do not meet the requirement (Reporter, Current Assignee or Group Custom Field) to any issues in the project should not be able to see the project and issues.

h3. Actual Results
Users that do not meet the requirement (Reporter, Current Assignee or Group Custom Field) to any issues in the project are able to see the project.

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Buggy 'Browse Project' permission

fields.description:
There are new vulnerabilities reported by apache:
 * [http://mail-archives.us.apache.org/mod_mbox/www-announce/201807.mbox/%3C20180722090435.GA60759%40minotaur.apache.org%3E]
 * [http://mail-archives.us.apache.org/mod_mbox/www-announce/201807.mbox/%3C20180722090623.GA92700%40minotaur.apache.org%3E]

It is recommended to update tomcat at least to version 8.5.32.

*Workaround*

 # Update Tomcat to 8.5.32 following this guide: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-upgrade-apache-tomcat-version-in-jira-7-x-879957866.html]
 # Add relaxedChars property to your server.xml as in here [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Changing+server.xml+to+handle+requests+with+special+characters]
fields.summary: Upgrade to Tomcat 8.5.32 necessary

fields.description:
h2. Background
* Currently, JIRA has a feature which allows users to contact a JIRA Admin using a form.
[^image-2018-07-31-21-26-22-239.png]
* After the user fills up the form and click "Send", an email containing contents of what was filled up in the form would be sent to all JIRA Administrator's email account.

h2. Suggestion
* It would be good if we could integrate this Contact Site Admin feature to create an issue within JIRA. 
** This helps in better and more efficient management of the Contact Site Admin request.
fields.summary: Integrate "Contact Site Administrator" to a project in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
Please update [Restoring information from a native backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/restoring-information-from-a-native-backup-935391706.html] to follow the format of [Restoring data from an xml backup \- |https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/restoring-data-from-an-xml-backup-935391704.html#Restoringdatafromanxmlbackup-restorexmldata]. In the initial document it is mentioned "Replace the JIRA Home directory with the backed up files." which creates confusion after reading [Backing up data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/backing-up-data-935391670.html] where it mentioned to backup only the data directory.
fields.summary: Improve the Document for JIRA Backup

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If we edit the name of a level of security scheme it remains the same on the create screen while it changes on the screen where the field is already present ( View screen). Also if we try to change the security level using the inline editing OR edit screen we see the modified security level.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Issue Security scheme with different levels and associate it with a project.
# Create a new issue and set the issue security level (say Level 1).
# Now navigate to Issues > Issue Security scheme and edit the name of the level (say Lvl 1).
# Create a new issue for the same project.

h3.  Expected Result
While creating a new issue we should see the modified security level (Lvl 1) in the drop-down. 

h3. Actual Result
We see the old Security Level (Level 1) on the create screen drop down while the changes take effect on the view screen.

h3. Workaround
We have to restart JIRA and only after that the changes take effect on the create screen.
fields.summary: Change in Security Level does not reflect on Create Screen without restart.

fields.description: Please we need you consider one integration between Jira Server and the GSuite tools, very usefull for bussiness like ours, that depends of server installations . Not only with Cloud.
fields.summary: Support for GSuite integration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When editing a comment, a pop-up screen will appear and user will need to edit the comment there. With this, users are unable to scroll the page if necessary.

h3. Suggested Solution
Edit comment as in-line, just as adding new comments. This will allow for the page to scroll while editing the comment.

h3. Workaround
Edit comment in a new tab and switch between tabs
fields.summary: Ability to scroll when editing comment

You are not permitted to add multiple global transitions to the same status."

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Open issue (<Jira URL>/browse/<issue_key>).
 # Open comment form and add some text there.
 # Lose focus from the form e.g. by hitting "tab" key (this can happen accidentally).
 # Hit ["U" key|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewKeyboardShortcuts!default.jspa].
 This will prompt "dirty form warning" saying:
 !warning.png!
 # Click "cancel" or hit "ESC" key.

h4. Expected result

We can continue writing comment. Content is still there.
h4. Actual result

We are moved to issue search view. Comment content is lost. :(
fields.summary: Hitting "U" key out of comment form focus erases form content

fields.description:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ADMINJIRASERVER/Importing+data+from+JSON

It would be helpful to clarify that if you're trying to create sub-tasks for custom sub-tasks links you need to keep the name "sub-taks-links" 

The example shows this but it's a little confusing and if you change the name things get really weird. 

i.e.

{code:xml}
 "links": [
        {
            "name": "sub-task-link",
            "sourceId": "2",
            "destinationId": "1"
{code}
fields.summary: Documentation update for JSON IMPORTER

fields.description:
I created an issue and diligently recorded an email exchange between myself and two others in its description (because they accurately described the change and the process by which we decided a change is needed complete with dates and error messages) along with Jira user references in the names of the senders and recipients of the messages. This naturally meant referencing myself a few times.

Lo and behold, after the issue was created Jira sent me a message giving me a heads up that I had mentioned myself on a Jira issue. Silly!

It would be better if Jira first checked if the user mentioned was the same who made the change in the first place, and omitted the email notification if the user mentioned him(her)self.
fields.summary: JIRA Server shouldn't send an email notification when a user mentions himself when creating an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14229].
{panel}
 

Hello Folks...

I give it a shot one more time:

Absolutely valuable Issue! 

See if u can get IT done.

 

Thx.

 

Is there any way to see the change history for a given Version of a project? For example let's say we create a Version for project X as below:

All hardware is ready to ship release date: jan 21, 2008

Then the project lead makes changes to the title, description or date. We would like to have a way to see the changes made to these fields similar to change logs for issues. Right now, when we look at Versions, there is no apparent way to tell when the Version was created and by whom or how many times it has been modified and what the previous values were. This is really useful to department managers since Versions act as a 'contract' of delivery and are therefore quite sensitive.
fields.summary: See history of changes made to a Version

fields.description:

fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to see indirect Issue links in the issue

fields.description:
When customer try to setup a secure connection to mail servers using SMTPS/SPOP/ SIMAP

h4. Steps to reproduce
# import the certificate the in trust store
# setup a secure SMTP connection with a server that 
# Enable TLS

h4. Expected result
# Connection to be established

h4. Actual result
This error appears in the log:
{code}
An error has occurred with sending the test email:
com.atlassian.mail.MailException: javax.mail.MessagingException: Could not connect to SMTP host: secure-smtp.server.com, port: 465;
nested exception is:
javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: Received fatal alert: handshake_failure
at com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl.sendWithMessageId(SMTPMailServerImpl.java:225)
at com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl.send(SMTPMailServerImpl.java:162)
at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.webwork.SendTestMail.doExecute(SendTestMail.java:107)
at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:165)
at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:63)
at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:39)
{code}

The mail server with   TLS v1.1 and v1.2 :
require the following cyphers :

ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA512
DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA512
ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384
DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384
ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA384

h4. workaround:
Install JAVA at least 8u161 :
http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk8-downloads-2133151.html
fields.summary: Support Java Cryptography Extension required for Secure connections with TLS v 1.1 and v 1.2

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It would be cool to have the ability to change the "hint" message that pops up on a customfield, for example, a userpicker field for a specific behaviour.

h3. Description
When a user clicks on a userpicker field, a hint pop up with the message "Please enter one or more characters". It would be cool to be able to edit this "hint message" to something cutomized for each customfield type.
fields.summary: Ability to change a customfield's "hint" message

fields.description:
Our users have been requesting a feature to make the comment preview button clearer.

 

As a user I would like the comment preview button to be made more obvious that it is a button to see how your comment will be displayed.

 

Why:
 * Users commonly make mistakes when they are commenting on an issue. Spelling mistakes, spacing mistakes, etc.  Going back and change these multiple times sends an email to all watchers and can become a lot of uncecessary emails.
fields.summary: Comment Preview button is not obvious

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71574].
  {panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Activity Stream shows users previous activities in JIRA. Some users would like to be able to export the activity record in a specific duration. to PDF/Word file. 

This would be useful for users/Admin because as per GDPR, users should be allowed to export their own activity history as well.


h3. Suggested Solution

Allow Activity Stream to be exportable and add an option of specific date interval which user can export.


h3. Workaround 

Manually expand the Activity Stream by clicking on "Show more" and save the content of the Activity Stream to a MS Word file.
fields.summary: Allow user to export Activity Stream

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently it is not possible to remove/hide the activity stream only for a project 

h3. Suggested Solution

Grant admins the ability to remove/hide this
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to remove/hide the activity stream only for a project

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, when system admin restarts JIRA which is currently being used by users, any unsaved work (adding comment, changing issue field, etc) will be lost.

For example; 
When the users is trying to submit a comment while JIRA is still on restarting mode, the user will lose the content (user will get directed to starting up page).

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to restart JIRA gracefully without impacting unsaved work. 
For example: 
* Having a pop up notification when restart is being triggered, so user will have time to copy their text first.
fields.summary: Having the option to restart JIRA gracefully

fields.description:
Scenario: In a create/transition screen that has a very long list of fields, when a user does not fill in a required field and proceed to create/transition the issue, it automatically scrolls up to the top of the screen instead of auto scrolling to the missing required field. This is very inconvenient when the screens have a long list of fields displayed, the user has to manually scroll down to find the field.

It would be nice if it auto scrolls to the first missing required field.
fields.summary: Implement auto scrolling to required fields in a screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Webhooks are triggered for the worklog events regardless of the JQL specified
h3. How to replicate
 # Navigate through {{Jira Administration > System > WebHooks}} and create a new one (+ Create a WebHook)
 # Specify the project in the JQL such as {{project = "X", }}include "worklog" events, and save it
 # Access any issue from other projects rather than "Project X" and log work (More > Log Work)
 # The WebHook is triggered without respecting the JQL of step 2

h3. Notes

This is not happening for other events such as "Issue: Created"
fields.summary: WebHooks based on "worklog" events do not respect the JQL in place

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user does not have the 'Bulk Change' Global Permission, they are still able to see the 'Bulk Operation' for sub-task. They can click on it and continue with the bulk operations. Only after the confirmation screen, the user will face Error 404 and the bulk operation will be dropped.

h3. Expected Results
The 'Bulk Operation' does not appear as they do not have sufficient permission.

h3. Actual Results
The 'Bulk Operation' is still visible despite user not having sufficient permission for the action.

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Users without 'Bulk Change' Global Permission can see 'Bulk Operation' option for sub-task

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when all the subtasks are completed in the board, JIRA will show a pop-up asking whether user would like to complete the parent task.

This behaviour is different in issue page where when all of the sub-tasks are completed by transitioning issue from the issue page, JIRA does not show any pop-up asking user whether they would like to complete the parent task as well.


h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a solution similar to JIRA Software so JIRA will show a pop-up when all the sub-tasks is transitioned to completed status from issue page.


h3. Workaround 

Transition subtasks in board.
fields.summary: Complete parent task when subtasks are completed

fields.description: It would be great if we could have a feature to bulk change component lead.
fields.summary: Bulk Update Component Lead

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA is unable to remove a group from a global permission if the 3 following conditions are verified:
 - this group is synced from an external Crowd application
 - this group contains upper cases
 - the Crowd application was first configured to output upper/lower cases and later configured to output lower cases only

h3. Steps to reproduce

Prerequisites:
 - Need to have a Crowd instance and a JIRA instance running and linked together via an application link
 - Need to configure Crowd as an external directory in JIRA via ⚙ > User Management > User Directories

Steps:
 - In Crowd:
 -- Create a new group that contains upper cases (for example: *JIRA_GROUP*)
 -- Configure the application used by JIRA to output lower case from the page "Application > Options" by ticking the option "Lower case output"
 - In JIRA:
 -- Synchronize the Crowd directory in ⚙ > User Management > User Directories
 -- Go to ⚙ > User Management > Groups, and notice that the group JIRA_GROUP has been synced in JIRA in lower case as *jira_group*
 -- Go to ⚙ > System > Global Permissions, and add the group *jira_group* to the permission "JIRA Administrators"
 - In Crowd:
 -- Un-tick the option "Lower case output" in "Application > Options"
 - In JIRA:
 -- Remove the Crowd directory from ⚙ > User Management > User Directories, and re-create it
 -- Synchronize the Crowd directory in ⚙ > User Management > User Directories
 -- Go to ⚙ > User Management > Groups, and notice that the group *JIRA_GROUP* has been synced in JIRA with the same case as in Crowd (*JIRA_GROUP*)
 -- Go to ⚙ > System > Global Permissions, and notice that the group is still showing in lower case as *jira_group*
 -- Try to remove the group *jira_group* from the permission "JIRA Administrators"

h3. Expected behavior:
 - The group *JIRA_GROUP* should be removed

h3. Observed behavior
 - Not only the group *JIRA_GROUP* is not removed, but also it is showing in all lower case (as *jira_group*), although it should be showing as *JIRA_GROUP* like it's the case in ⚙ > User Management > Groups

h3. Workaround
 - In Crowd:
 -- Configure the application used by JIRA to output lower case from the page "Application > Options" by ticking the option "Lower case output"
 - In JIRA:
 -- Remove the Crowd directory from ⚙ > User Management > User Directories, and re-create it
 -- Synchronize the Crowd directory in ⚙ > User Management > User Directories
 -- Go to ⚙ > User Management > Groups, and notice that the group *JIRA_GROUP* has been synced in JIRA in lower case as *jira_group*
 -- Go to ⚙ > System > Global Permissions and remove the group jira_group from the permission "JIRA Administrators"
fields.summary: Can't remove a group from a global permission under certain conditions if the group comes from Crowd

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When navigating the issue view screen with the Tab key and reaching the activity section (see screenshot), the NVDA screen reader cannot tell whether the tab on focus is active/shown or inactive/hidden. 
h3. Environment
Issue occurs with NVDA on all browsers. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install the NVDA screen reader
# Tab-navigate to the activity issue tab panel

h3. Expected Results
The screen reader should be able to tell whether the tab is active or not. 
h3. Actual Results
The screen reader just reads the tab name and doesn't say if it's active or hidden. 
h3. Notes
Issue is always applicable to issue fields tab panel. 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Jira Accessibility: NVDA screen reader cannot tell whether tab is active or inactive in the issue activity tab panel

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Fields in the view issue screen cannot be navigated to using the Tab key if their values are not links.
h3. Environment
This is reproducible in all browsers. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to an issue
# Keep hitting tab to go from one field to the next

h3. Expected Results
All fields should be focused so screen-readers can read the values in them. 
h3. Actual Results
Fields such as issue type, priority, ... are not skipped, thus a screen reader cannot read the values.
h3. Notes
Impacted fields will become navigable if they have hyperlink values such as Labels, Component/s, ...
h3.Workaround
By default, only hyperlinks, buttons and form fields are tab navigable. More items can be added if they have the HTML property *{{tabindex}}* set to a 0+ value.
A workaround would be to run extra JavaScript on the issue view screen to the *{{tabindex}}* value. For example: 
{code}
document.getElementById("customfield_10880-val").tabIndex=0
{code}
fields.summary: Jira Accessibility: Cannot tab-navigate to fields in the issue view screen

fields.description:
h5. Problem definition
We have limited options of workflow triggers and conditions, validators, and permissions will be ignored for automatic transitions. We would like to configure automatic transitions to have conditions on the pull request destination.

h5. Suggested solution

fields.summary: Automatic transitions should allow more conditions on the pull request destination branch

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If no one has permission to clone an issue when it's in the initial workflow status (the status the issue will be upon being created), it's not possible to create a new issue via REST API, if the issue to be created uses the same workflow.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Edit the workflow of issue type T in project P
# Click View Properties at the initial step e.g. Open
# Add this property:
{code}
Key: jira.permission.createclone.denied
Value: true
{code}
# Publish the workflow
# Create a new issue P-1 via GUI using issue type T in project P

h3. Expected behavior
# No one can clone P-1
# A new issue P-2 can be created via REST API using issue type T in project P (similar to how P-1 can be created via GUI)

h3. Actual behavior
# No one can clone P-1 (/)
# A new issue P-2 can't be created via REST API using issue type T in project P (x)

The following *400 Bad Request* error is thrown:
{code}
{
    "errorMessages": [],
    "errors": {
        "summary": "Field 'summary' cannot be set. It is not on the appropriate screen, or unknown."
    }
}
{code}
(!) This error is invalid because:
# Summary field is a known, required system field
# It's available on the Create Issue screen of issue type T in project P

h3. Workaround
Grant the REST API user (e.g. admin) the permission to clone issues in the initial workflow status, by adding this property (keeping the other so that no one else can clone issues):
{code}
Key: jira.permission.createclone.user
Value: admin
{code}

Then use *admin* for the REST API call to create issues.

(+) The permission can also be granted to a specific group:
{code}
Key: jira.permission.createclone.group.1
Value: jira-administrators
{code}

h3. Notes
This ticket supersedes JRASERVER-45995, JRASERVER-59487, and JRASERVER-62200, because *incorrect keys* are used there:
* jira.permission.create.clone
* jira.permission.create.clone.denied

(!) When using these incorrect keys, JIRA throws these valid errors:
{code}
Unknown type 'clone' in meta attribute 'jira.permission.create.clone'. Valid permission types are defined in permission-types.xml
Unknown type 'clone' in meta attribute 'jira.permission.create.clone.denied'. Valid permission types are defined in permission-types.xml
{code}

(+) Using the right keys as mentioned in this ticket:
* JRASERVER-45995 is superseded by this ticket, and the same workaround can be applied (*g)
* JRASERVER-59487 and JRASERVER-62200 are not valid any more (/)
fields.summary: Using jira.permission.createclone.denied on Initial Workflow Status breaks Issue Creation via REST API

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, we have an option to list users in a group using REST API. However, we do not have a rest call to list all the groups in the Jira instance. 

h3. Suggested Solution

REST call to retrieve all groups present in Jira using REST API
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to retrieve all the groups that's exists in JIRA using REST API

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The Reporter and Assignee fields default to different positions in a board's detail view vs. issue view. The Detail View is configurable, whereas the Issue View is not. This means that in order to make the positions consistent across Jira, you have to reconfigure the order in *every* project. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Make the order of the Reporter and Assignee configurable in the Issue View. 

h3. Why this is important
 
Changing the default position on every board is very time consuming. New boards will default to Reporter above Assignee, which means that every single board needs to be configured. 

h3. Workaround 

Change the default position for every board.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like the order of the Reporter and Assignee fields to be configureable on the Issue View screen, so that I can change to match the default order on Detail View

fields.description: The look and feel after Jira 7.10 does not provide the ability to change the background color of the quick search bar. It is stuck with a dark blue color scheme that does not go well with what we have.
fields.summary: Add option to change quick search bar background color in look and feel

fields.description:
When a user session is moved from one server to another, all session information is lost, including login credentials. When this happens, the user is forced to re-login in JIRA in order to create a new session.

Please implement user session replication between the nodes in order to avoid that.
fields.summary: Ability to have user session replication between the nodes in Jira Data Center (DC)

fields.description:

Similar request raised here:
https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Core-questions/Adding-column-to-Release-Page/qaq-p/159721
fields.summary: Allow Adding Columns to Release View

fields.description:
From https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/project-settingss-sidebar-broken-jira-p2-and-react/20982.

Jira's approach to registering the {{moment}} library does not work as expected if the {{babel-polyfill}} is present in the environment, since it creates the {{global}} variable. When this global variable is present, moment does not export itself to the AMD module that Jira expects it to, which can cause a cascade of JavaScript errors further down in the batch file that moment is included in. This, in turn, can cause cryptic errors like this one:

{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot set property ‘registerHotspotTour’ of undefined
at hotspot-tour.js:18
at hotspot-tour.js:232
Uncaught Error: undefined missing jira/projects/sidebar/expansion-manager
at l (batch.js:25)
at batch.js:25
batch.js:25 Uncaught Error: undefined missing jira/projects/sidebar/sidebar-placeholder-initializer
at l (batch.js:25)
at batch.js:25
{noformat}

The code in Jira needs to be updated to avoid exporting to {{global}} when it is present, and guarantee that the library is available through the `jslibs/moment-2.6.0` AMD module it consumes.
fields.summary: Cascade of JavaScript errors caused if `window.global` is defined

fields.description:
Digital whiteboard are becoming more and more available. As such they open the opportunity to use them for a daily.

 

A few key things that need to be ensured:
 * this should work for both kanban and scrum boards
 * login must easily be "persisted" so no time of the entire team is wasted logging into Jira
 * the UI must be touch screen friendly (ie. scrolling must be possible) while also allowing to drag and drop items
 * it might be nice to be able to zoom into parts of the board or specific tickets to allow people standing further away from the board to see what is being talked about or moved (the zoom area must easily be moved left or right .. ideally it would auto choose the side based on of the person moving tickets is standing left or right of the board)
 * it must be easy for people approaching the board to set themselves as the "context", so that they can quickly assign tickets to themselves.
 * it must also be easy to assign tickets to others (maybe a list of names on to which tickets can be dragged)
 * ability to easily pull up burn down or other charts would be a nice to have
fields.summary: scrum/kanban view optimized for a daily on a touch screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When utilizing Crowd SSO auth to Jira, the crowd.token_key cookie is not removed if a user's Crowd session is expired.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a Crowd Server
 # Integrate Jira with Crowd using the SSO Seraph authenticator
 # Authenticate to Jira as a Crowd user, view browser cookies and observe presence of *crowd.token_key* cookie
 # Forcibly expire the user's session in Crowd
 # Wait for the Crowd *session.validationinterval* value to expire (2 minutes by default)
 # Try to load a Jira page, you should be logged out and redirected to login page
 # Refresh and view cookies, observe that the *crowd.token_key* cookie is still present.

h3. Expected Results

The cookie should be removed from subsequent requests, as it is with Bitbucket.
h3. Actual Results

Cookie persists, and each attempt to load the page before re-authenticating will perform a POST call to the Crowd server for a no-longer extant Crowd session, e.g.:
{noformat}
http://ssotest.private:8095/crowd/rest/usermanagement/1/session/Ew68GQY0DZYVT8W9A0UzDA00
404 - Not Found
{noformat}
Jira will retry the POST request 4x+ times before user is redirected to a login page.

Jira should also remove the cookie when it performs the redirect.
fields.summary: crowd.token_key not removed if Crowd session is expired

# Make sure that there is no other string on the URL after the issue key like "<JIRA Base URL>/browse/KAN-1" 
# At the "Sub-Tasks" option, click the Triple Dot and select "Bulk Operation"
# Select the two sub-tasks and proceed to click next.

h3. Expected Result:
The option of what kind of operation to be done will be listed.

h3. Actual Result:
This appears instead:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
With log snippet:
{noformat}
2018-07-23 14:31:59,422 http-nio-8017-exec-17 ERROR      [c.a.j.web.servlet.InternalServerErrorServlet] {errorId=84e3922f-f45a-48c7-abc1-031ad6c45706, interpretedMsg=, cause=java.lang.NullPointerException, stacktrace=java.lang.NullPointerException
    	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.bulkedit.BulkEdit1.lambda$getQuery$0(BulkEdit1.java:229) [classes/:?]

h3. Summary
If a user is renamed, with:
* New username stored in {{*cwd_user.user_name*}}
* Original username stored in {{*app_user.user_key*}}

JIRA API may not be able to find the user in many cases. It seems some API methods/endpoints use *user_name*, while the others use *user_key*, in an inconsistent manner.

h5. Known bugs
* [JRASERVER-36642 - After renaming users in JIRA, worklogs do not expand author correctly in REST API|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-36642]
* [JRASERVER-67262 - Updating roles through REST API did not work using username|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67262]

h3. Suggestion
Improve JIRA API to handle renamed users in a more consistent manner, and have this documented properly in the API docs.
fields.summary: JIRA API should handle renamed users better

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
According to REST API {{/rest/api/2/settings/baseUrl}} docs ( see [settings-setBaseURL|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.6.4/#api/2/settings-setBaseURL])
* Jira expects _"application/json"_ content type for the request:
bq. The JIRA REST API uses JSON as its communication format .. 
* and the example shows that simple string should be used as a payload:
{noformat}
EXAMPLE
http://jira.atlassian.com/
{noformat}

However, according to JSON specification strings should be quoted, which makes the payload invalid JSON. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Change the API so that {{settings/baseUrl}} operation used JSON as a payload and update docs accordingly. 
 
h3. Workaround 
Use unquoted string as a payload as documented.
fields.summary: REST API baseUrl put operation should use valid JSON payload

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The way Jira cleans up some of it's request caches can lead to memory leaks for code executed outside of HTTP threads - caesium jobs or plugin-supplied long running threads.

h3. Details 

It applies to all request-scope caches provided by {{JiraAuthenticationContextImpl}} ({{AuthenticationContextImpl}}) and managed by {{JiraThreadLocalUtils}}.

Jira API provides plugin vendors with a way to execute code outside of HTTP requests scope with {{OffRequestThreadExecutor}}
It's supposed to properly initiate and destroy request caches.

{{JiraAuthenticationContextImpl.clearRequestCache();}} is called on {{preCall}}, but not on {{postCall}}

Because of that request caches will not be cleaned up until the consecutive run of the job on the same java thread.

h3. Expected results

Request caches are being cleaned properly after a plugin-supplied code is executed.

h3. Actual results

Request caches are not cleaned and accumulate lots of unneeded objects in memory.

h3. Workaround

Calling {{JiraAuthenticationContextImpl.clearRequestCache();}} would ensure that a job is not leaving anything behind.
fields.summary: Request caches based on JiraAuthenticationContextImpl can lead to a memory leak

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Bulk Create and CSV Import are 2 different features:
 * CSV Import is meant for JIRA admins and an admin can use it to import almost everything without restriction
 * Bulk Create is meant for non-JIRA admins and only new issues can be created in bulk, respecting what can be done using the Create button in the GUI

In brief:
||Bulk Create||CSV Import||
| * Only new issues can be imported
 * Existing issues can't be updated
 * Only fields available on Create Issue screen can be mapped (Parent/Sub-task link is supported)
 * New entities can't be created if not exists e.g. project, users, custom fields
 ** Default values will be used where applicable e.g. issue types, priorities
 * Attachments, Comments, Work Logs can't be imported| * New issues can be imported
 * Existing issues can be updated
 * All system/custom fields can be mapped
 * New entities/values can be created if not exists e.g. project, users, custom fields, issue types, priorities
 * Attachments, Comments, Work Logs can be imported|

h3. Problem
The doc for [Creating issues using the CSV importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-939937906.html] (Bulk Create) contains everything that can be done with [Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-csv-938847533.html] (CSV Import) e.g.:
* Attachments, Comments, Work Logs can be imported
* New users and custom fields can be created if not exists

The doc must be fixed to clearly differentiate between the 2 features.
fields.summary: Bulk Create is a seriously wrong copy of CSV Import

fields.description:
h3. Version :JIRA Agile v7.7.0-DAILY20180208023034

 

Sometimes it is very frustrating to add an attachment via Jira web interface - this not only due to low upload speed.

My suggestion is to use an internal mail server and give an option to +*s*+{color:#172b4d}+_*end an email to an issue.*_+{color}

 

For each ticket number, you can define if it supports emails attachments and also manage a white list of sender's email address. Other email senders can be blocked or lock their attachments in a vault until it is verified. 

Main usage for this feature:
 * Automation will send a mail to update latest build results
 * Sending info from the customer without login or without an account to Jira
 * adding an option to send the item to many recipients at the same time (ex: adding Jira number in the bcc).
 * Adding many new bugs to Jira :)

 

 

From the Internet emails will be routed to the company@jira.domainname mail server so a typical Example :email with attachment  will look like this:

 
{code:java}
From:Mr@domain.soffix
TO:Ticketnum@jira.Domainname.dontcare
Attachments: a Movie and a song
{code}
 

 No need for huge amount of email addresses (each ticket will have its own virtual email address)
fields.summary: Email address for each ticket number

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There could be race condition between Jira DC index replication thread {{NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1}} and Jira {{localhost-startStop-1}} thread during the start-up.
Start of the {{NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1}} is not synchronized with start-up thread, it just has 10sec delay. In some conditions, this time will be not enough and this could lead to the contention of the resources and possible start-up failure (see for example JRASERVER-67613) or slow start-up. 

h3. Environment
* Jira DC

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start Jira node 
# Create condition when Jira starts takes a long time, see for example JRASERVER-67614
# Start taking frequent thread dumps with 2s intervals, we see both 2 thread _RUNNABLE_:
{noformat}
"NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1" #172 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f3696f9a800 nid=0x43de runnable [0x00007f34d19ea000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE

"localhost-startStop-1" #29 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f36a0001800 nid=0x4227 runnable [0x00007f3701afe000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
Thread {{NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1}} will finish for the initialization of the Jira start. 

h3. Notes
None

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Start of Jira datacenter replication thread NodeReindexServiceThread is not synchronised with Jira start localhost-startStop thread

fields.description:
h4. Problem
During startup, Jira performs a consistency check for various items, including a check to see if the index locations already have an existing lock.  There are no explicit waits on this, so at times the check may run after existing services/job have already started.  This may cause the consistency check to fail and the result is Jira startup will fail.
* This has been found to occur in a Data Center environment where the {{NodeReindexServiceThread}} starts indexing before the consistency checker. This results in index write.lock check errors.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
One situation found to delay the consistency checker is JMX monitoring, see JRASERVER-67614 for details. So we'll use this as an example.

# Startup Jira Data Center Node with JMX enabled
** Notice that there is a long delay during startup, in this case ~20s:
{code}
2018-07-13 17:55:09,844 localhost-startStop-1 INFO [c.a.j.instrumentation.external.DatabaseExternalGauges] Installing DBCP monitoring instruments: DatabaseExternalGauges.JiraDbcpInstruments[instruments=[DBCP_MAX, DBCP_ACTIVE, DBCP_IDLE],objectName=com.atlassian.jira:name=BasicDataSource]

2018-07-13 17:55:38,300 localhost-startStop-1 WARN      [c.a.jira.health.HealthChecks] Your database is using an unsupported collation
{code}
# After waiting for a longer period, we see:
{code}
    ********************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************
    Index lock file(s) found. This occurs either because JIRA was not cleanly shutdown
    or because there is another instance of this JIRA installation currently running.
    Please ensure that no other instance of this JIRA installation is running
    and then remove the following lock file(s) and restart JIRA:
    
    UtilConcurrentLock{lock=true, fullLockName=/opt/atlassian/home/caches/indexes/comments/write.lock} UtilConcurrentLock{lock=true, fullLockName=/opt/atlassian/home/caches/indexes/issues/write.lock} UtilConcurrentLock{lock=true, fullLockName=/opt/atlassian/home/caches/indexes/changes/write.lock} UtilConcurrentLock{lock=true, fullLockName=/opt/atlassian/home/caches/indexes/worklogs/write.lock}
    
    Once restarted you will need to reindex your data to ensure that indexes are up to date.
    
    Do NOT delete the lock file(s) if there is another JIRA running with the same index directory
    instead cleanly shutdown the other instance.
    ********************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************
{code}

h5. Diagnosing
If receiving the index write.lock errors, we can diagnose by:
* Enable DEBUG logging on the following packages via log4j.properties and restart Jira:
{code}
com.atlassian.jira.index.LuceneCorruptionChecker
com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyCheckerImpl
com.atlassian.jira.startup.JiraStartupLogger
com.atlassian.jira.util.LuceneDirectoryUtilsImpl.UtilConcurrentLock
{code}
** This will detect if index operations are occurring before the the consistency checker
* Capture thread dumps in short 2 second intervals to examine what's happening during the startup delay.

h5. Workaround
In the case where JMX monitoring is causing startup delays in Jira Data Center, disable JMX monitoring before starting up the new node.  Once startup is complete, JMX monitoring can be re-enabled.
fields.summary: Race Condition with Jira Startup Consistency Checker Can Result in File Lock Errors

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When copying a specific pattern of text from Office tools on Windows or Mac and trying to paste on Jira, it will fail, usually hiding part of the text.

h3. Description

If you have an specific pattern of text that included a Dash symbol + tab + file name with extension, when copied from Office tools and pasted into Jira it will basically hide the file's name and keep only the extension.
If the user copy the same text from other tool, like notepad, it works as expected.
If the user copy from Office tools, but pastes on other tools other than Jira, it works as expected.
fields.summary: Copying from Office tools fails to paste correctly on Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When calling Jira's REST API to search for issues using a JQL, if you call it using this URL "<base_url>/rest/api/2/search?filter=<filter_id>" it will return all issues from the instance and not an error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Call the REST API using the following URL:
{noformat}
<base_url>/rest/api/2/search?filter=<filter_id>
{noformat}


h3. Expected Results
Return an error since the "filter" field is not a valid query string.

h3. Actual Results
Jira returns all issues from the instance.

h3.Workaround
For the search to work, the URL should be as follows:
{noformat}
<base_url>/rest/api/2/search?jql=filter=<filter_id>
{noformat}

Adding the "jql=" after the "search?".
fields.summary: REST API search issue doesn't return error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The sorting icon under the Activity section of Issue View is not working in IE11, the sorting 'arrow' icon is non-clickable. 

h3. Environment
Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Type a few comments and then try to sort them using the sorting 'arrow' icon.

h3.Expected Results
The sorting 'arrow' icon is clickable. See the result in Google Chrome:
!chrome_is_working.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The sorting 'arrow' icon is not clickable. 
!ie_not_working.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround 1
You can sort the items by changing the URL, for example: 

To sort in ascending order: 
{code}
<base-url>/browse/AAA-12345?actionOrder=asc
{code}

To sort in descending order: 
{code}
<base-url>/browse/AAA-12345?actionOrder=desc
{code}

h3. Workaround 2
Use other web browsers such as Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, or Microsoft Edge. 

h3. Workaround 3
Add the following to your announcement banner:
{code}
<style type="text/css">
#activitymodule .aui-tabs .sortwrap { z-index: 999 !important; }
</style>
{code}
Thanks to [~bert.dombrecht] for this suggestion!
fields.summary: The sorting icon under the Activity section of Issue View is not working in IE11

fields.description:
h3. Expected Behavior

When an IOException is encountered during reindexing or restoring an index, Jira is able to retry the operation a few times before failing.
h3. Actual Behavior

If an IOException is being thrown, e.g. because a file is being locked by another process, the reindex/index restore stops, which usually results in a corrupted index.
This usually happens due to a running anti-virus or due to [JDK-4724038|https://bugs.java.com/view_bug.do?bug_id=4724038] bug on Windows.
The problem can manifest itself with an exception like this:
{code:java}
2018-07-10 22:58:51,518 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService] Index restore started. Snapshot file: IndexSnapshot_16400.zip
2018-07-10 22:59:03,221 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager] Restoring search indexes - 1% complete... Replacing indexes
2018-07-10 22:59:03,486 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 ERROR      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService] Error re-indexing node changes
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.io.IOException: Unable to delete file: D:\Atlassian\JIRA\caches\indexes\issues\_9j.cfs
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager$ReplaceIndexRunner.run(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:344)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.withReindexLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:377)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:22)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy19.withReindexLock(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.recoverIndexFromBackup(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:121)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService$MessageConsumer.restoreIndex(DefaultIndexCopyService.java:154)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService.restoreIndex(DefaultIndexCopyService.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.updateAffectedIndexes(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:293)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.reIndex(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:252)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.runAndReset(FutureTask.java:308)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$301(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:180)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:294)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Unable to delete file: D:\Atlassian\JIRA\caches\indexes\issues\_9j.cfs
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.forceDelete(FileUtils.java:1919)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.cleanDirectory(FileUtils.java:1399)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.deleteDirectory(FileUtils.java:1331)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager$ReplaceIndexRunner.replaceIndexes(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:407)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager$ReplaceIndexRunner.run(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:342)
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Lock one of the Lucene's files inside Jira home and start a reindex.
h3. Workaround

Exclude Jira home directory from anti-virus scans.
If the problem is a result of the JVM bug, there is no known workaround for this at the moment (beside using Linux ;)).
fields.summary: Improve IOException handling during reindexing and restoring an index

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the Cumulative Flow Diagram (CFD) report in JIRA has limited function. It will be great if the CFD report can be enhanced to include more functions such as the ability:
 - to extract the delivery rate and/or cycle time for a specific period
 - to change the status colors on the graph
 - to change the default timeframe of the report when accessing it from the Project report menu (currently, it is using the "All time" Timeframe by default
 - to specify custom dates aside from the click and drag option to select a date/time frame. Currently, we can manually enter the date but not with a specific date click from the calendar.

h3. Suggested Solution

Enhance the capability of the Cumulative Flow Diagram functions.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Improve JIRA's Cumulative Flow Diagram functions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to stop watching the issue after adding a comment via a screen on the issue. The user will be a watcher if we enable _Autowatch own issues_ at [User Default Settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-the-user-default-settings-938847012.html] after commenting on the issue.
 # We are able to remove the user after creating an issue from the watcher list.
 # We are able to remove the user after adding a comment.
 # We are *not* able to remove the user if the user transition the issue and a comment (there is a screen associated to the transition) from the watcher list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue.
 # Remove the user from the watcher list.
 # Transition the issue to any status that has a screen tied to the transition and add a comment using the screen.
 # Click on _Stop watching this issue_.
 # Refresh the page and the user will be still the watcher.

h3. Expected Results

The user to be removed from the watcher list.
h3. Actual Results

The user is not being removed from the watcher list. For reference; {{[https://www.screencast.com/t/clldbGH1q]}}.
h3. Workaround
 # To send a POST request before the DELETE request - this means we have to click on the watcher button 3 times for it to send DELETE - POST - DELETE request; please refer to the end of the video recording; {{[https://www.screencast.com/t/clldbGH1q]}}.
OR
 # We can disable the _Autowatch own issues_.
fields.summary: Unable to stop watching after being added by auto-add watcher feature

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Jira, the *Attachments Health Check* checks that recent attachments can be found and opened. It fails in the circumstances where an issue has an attachment (at least visible via the UI and in the database), but the corresponding attachment is not found in the filesystem.

When an attachment is deleted from a Jira issue at the same time that the Attachments Health Check is being ran, there exists a narrow period of time where the health check may first identify that an attachment exists in a ticket (prior to the attachment being deleted), and then fail to find the attachment in the filesystem (after the attachment was deleted).

This can be avoided if the Attachments Health Check can lock the attachments directory in the filesystem until complete, though care is required to avoid unexpected repercussions in Jira's other functionalities.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Delete an attachment from an issue
# Have the Attachments Health Check be performed (by actively loading the *Administration >> System >> Support Tools* page, or passively in the background)

h3. Expected Results

The Attachments Health Check does not fail as a result of an attachment being deleted.

h3. Actual Results

* An Attachments Health Check warning is thrown in an alert in the upper right corner of the page
* The *Support Tools* administration page shows a failure for the Attachments Health Check warning
* Application logs contain the following error:
** {{com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.NoAttachmentDataException: Attachment does not exist in filesystem /PATH/TO/FILE}}
 
h3. Notes

Incidence rate is rare, and issue is difficult to induce at will.

h3.Workaround

If the failure is immediately unobservable when refreshing the page or double checking the *Support Tools* page, it can be inferred that this issue has occurred and that there is no actual failure.
fields.summary: Race Condition in Attachments Health Check when attachments are deleted simultaneously

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When @mentioning a user and then typing, followed by pasted text, the visual editor changes the order - causing the pasted text to appear immediately after the @mention instead of the correct location.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using the 'Visual' comment section, type some text
# @mention a user and select them 
# Type a word or two
# Paste some copied text (or a url) 

h3. Expected Results
The text should appear as text, @mention, text, pasted text.

h3. Actual Results
The text appears as text, @mention, _pasted text_, text

h3.Workaround
Use Text mode or edit the text after pasting.
fields.summary: As a user, when I paste a link after mentioning a user the format is changed in visual mode

fields.description:
h4. Description
Under certain scenarios where the JVM cannot allocate memory, the user interface gets stuck forever and no errors are thrown, leading no clues of what happened, since just the server logs do show the exception logged by the JVM before it crashed. This was seen mostly when the instance crashes on Jira startup tasks.

h4. Suggestion
Either throw on the user interface the JVM stack trace or close the connections in a way that the browser does return an error, instead of simply having the user interface spinning forever and misleading administrators to think that the instance is still running.
fields.summary: Crashes due to OOM may cause the user interface to hang forever

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition 

When creating an issues from the {{CreateIssue.jspa}} page, the *Create* button can be pressed multiple times in succession to create duplicate tickets.

h3. Suggested Solution 

Disable the button after the first click. This is how the *Create* modal works, but if you open it in a new page instead you are taken to the {{CreateIssue.jspa}} page where the *Create* button is not disabled after clicking.

h3. Why this is important 

Users are inadvertently creating duplicate tickets because of multiple clicks.

h3. Workaround 
Use the *Create* modal rather than the {{CreateIssue.jspa}} page.
fields.summary: Prevent duplicate clicks on "CREATE" button when creating a new issue

fields.description:
Currently, there is no easy way to see which scheduled tasks took the longest to execute. It's only possible to see the scheduler runners sorted alphabetically by name (press _gg_, type "Scheduler" and click enter), which is hard to navigate.

Add an admin page with a list of the scheduled jobs, sorted by the last run duration to improve the visibility into what's going on inside the scheduler.
fields.summary: Provide a UI to check the slowest scheduled jobs

fields.description:
Currently it is only possible to search for empty (no values) in some fields like component or version in basic mode. For fields of type custom field this is not possible in basic mode. To perform such a query the user has to switch to advanced mode.

But as in our 10.000 user enterprise installation we have lots of users that are only unregular not software affine users we have a bif problem with this. These kind of users are only accepting the basic filter als filter instrument, as they don't understand  the  functionality and usability of the advanced filter at all.

So our request is to also add the option "no value" as selectable option to fileds of type custom field in basic filter mode.
fields.summary: Filter for empty custom fields should be possible also in basic filter

fields.description: Please see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46726 for a bug that was reintroduced at 7,x  and has not been fixed for YEARS now making the report nearly useless as well as the use of Component less useful.  I did fill it in for this ticket, so maybe you can try it for yourselves.  Vey disappointed in the level of support for what should be an easy fix (since it was already working!!)
fields.summary: Atlassian is not fixing regression issues quickly enough

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if a JIRA Admin replaced groups in LDAP with another set of groups, he/she will have to manually reconfigure the Permission Scheme to update new groups.


h3. Suggested Solution

Allow JIRA Admin to bulk update Permission Scheme to update groups set in the Permission Schemes.


h3. Workaround 

Manually edit each of the Permission Scheme one by one.
fields.summary: Update Permission Scheme with new groups from AD

fields.description:
When we link an issue to another one on the resolution screen, it looks like the linked issue is the one making the action mentioned next to “Linked Issues”. Say, we resolve issue A, and on the resolution screen, it shows: “Linked Issue: Cause” and under it shows issue B. It looks like Issue B causes issue A. After the transition is complete, it actually shows that Issue A causes issue B.

The suggestion would be to either reverse the logic, to keep consistency with what the transition screen is saying, OR rename the field “Linked Issue” to make it more clear which issue is causing the other one.
fields.summary: Confusing wording on linked issues

 !English Translation.png|thumbnail!  !German Translation.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if 2 users are viewing the same issue page & 1 of them edited the page, the issue page will not show the updated entry until the 2nd user manually refresh the page.

This could cause problem since the 2nd user could be editing the issue at the same time not knowing the that the 1st user has updated the issue.


h3. Suggested Solution

# Allow JIRA to auto refresh the issue page when the issue is updated.
# Show who's looking at the page similar to the feature provided by [this|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211596/whos-looking-for-jira-cloud] plugin.


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Auto refresh issue page

h3. Actual Results

Restart Jira.

fields.description:
This is a request from the customer to improve the documentation from https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile whereby some of the link has outdated link provided and these link doesn't direct our customer to the relevant documentation.

Customer noticed some of the issue from below:
{quote}
ERROR 1 : Link fails
From page "https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile" clicking on the "Quick start guide" I get an error - 
++++++++++++++++++++
Something went wrong.
We're moving mountains to get it sorted.
View our status page and subscribe for
service updates.
++++++++++++++++++++

ERROR 2: Link on this page leads to unrelated content
The "bug reports" link in "visit our system status and bug reports for the latest updates on known issues" takes you to a page with a browser tab title "Raise a feature request", nothing that seems to promise any bug report details.

ERROR 3: This page does not accept the actual URL 
It seems to only want our 'product' site and does not recognise your core sites URLs.

ERROR 4: This page wipes all content without warning if value is changed.
Looking at the URL I wondered whether I had selected the wrong product, so I changed it from JIRA to Confluence, and WHAMMO, all my work was wiped out without any warning, checking, or a "by your please". Like most people, I especially hate unnecessary rework, and this kind of sloppy web design does not encourage people to give you feedback.

Note - when I selected "Confluence" as the product, I did see the Known Issue above (When accessing, editing or publishing page in Confluence error is shown: Something's gone wrong. Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support.), however, I decided it was worth still sending this feedback as i) there are multiple issues above, and ii) my error message is a bit different to this one
{quote}
